newsitem.title: USA: South Jersey sets shareholder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: South Jersey sets shareholder rights plan.

text.p: South Jersey Industries Inc said on Friday its board of directors adopted a shareholder rights plan and declared a dividend distribution of one right per common share payable to holders of record on October 11.
The company said in a statement rights would initially be represented by stock certificates and would trade with the common shares.

Each right would entitle shareholders to by one one-thousandth of share of the company's newly created preference stock at an exercise price of $90. Rights, which expire on September 20, 2006, would only be exercisable if a person or group acquired 10 percent or more of South Jersey Industries or announced a tender offer, the company said.

If South Jersey Industries was acquired or a person or group bought a stake of 10 percent or more, the right would let holders buy a number of the acquiring company's shares or of South Jersey Industries' common stock, the company said.
This would mean a market value of twice the exercise price, it said.

"The rights are not being distributed in response to any specific effort to acquire control of the company and the board is not aware of any such effort," Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer William Ryan said in a statement.
